findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Phoenix franchise ($320M annual revenue, 35% of collection) expires Dec 2029. RFP Dec 2027. Retention probability 60-65% baseline, reduced to 35-50% if labor strike occurs or 20-25% labor cost disadvantage from pattern bargaining.
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: First-year revenue loss at risk; franchise represents 35% of UESC collection revenue

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Six Teamsters CBAs expire June 30, 2026 (5,400 employees). Pattern bargaining precedent: Phoenix Local 104 achieved 19% increase over 4 years (March 2024). Expected settlement: $117M over 4 years.
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: DCF of annual wage increases at 8% discount rate over 4-year contract term

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Three known Superfund sites: Tucson Airport ($27M-$35M settlement range, active § 107 litigation), Albuquerque South Valley ($18M-$51M if NPL-listed), Motorola 52nd Street ($2.75M-$3.45M de minimis settlement). Probability-weighted: $88.8M-$90.4M.
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: Midpoint of settlement ranges; Tucson 70% settlement/30% litigation probability; Albuquerque 50% NPL listing probability

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Sierra Vista TSDF ($85M revenue, 35% EBITDA margin) permit expires Dec 2025. EPA issued info deficiency letter Sept 2024. Scenarios: 55-60% approval without conditions ($0), 20-25% enhanced conditions ($3M-$36M), 10-15% delay ($181M-$363M discount), 5-10% denial ($425M-$510M).
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: Probability-weighted across 4 scenarios; P50 expected value $75.6M

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Desert View landfill expansion application (March 2025 hearing). Denial probability 40-50%. If denied: 1.6 years remaining airspace, $260M-$340M exposure (early closure + stranded assets + alternative disposal).
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: Midpoint of denial cost range ($300M); accounts for early closure, stranded assets, and alternative disposal premium

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Strike probability 15-20% (June-Aug 2026). 8-10 week duration. One-time cost $24M-$30M + annual customer attrition $3M-$8M. Amplifies Phoenix franchise loss risk by 15 percentage points.
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: One-time strike cost + NPV of 3-year customer attrition at 8% discount

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Recycling segment: $240M revenue, -$29M EBITDA (-12% margin), 22% contamination rate. Technology investment required: $10M-$20M (4 MRFs). Status quo: -$145M cumulative 5-year loss. No EPR legislation in AZ/NV/NM.
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: 5-year cumulative EBITDA loss under status quo scenario; DCF at 8%

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Fort Huachuca IDIQ ($350M, expires 2030): DOL investigation for prevailing wage violations. Back wages $2.8M-$8.5M + debarment risk. Hanford $120M contract also at risk if debarred.
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: Midpoint of back wages range ($5.65M); excludes debarment impact (captured in contract value risk)

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: $14.4M annual benefit from interstate waste optimization (Las Vegas→CA $9M savings, CA backhaul $5.4M revenue). Hypothetical state restrictions <5% probability. 'Nevada AB 129' cited in materials does not exist.
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: Worst-case loss of all interstate optimization if restrictions enacted and upheld (extremely low probability per 45 years Supreme Court precedent)

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Sierra Vista: Ongoing groundwater treatment from 1998 release. Estimated remaining costs $15M-$25M over 10-15 years. Potential overruns $5M-$10M if remedy requires enhancement.
findings_by_domain.valuation_methodology: Midpoint of cost range ($20M) + midpoint of potential overruns ($7.5M); DCF over 12-year average timeline at 8%

correlation_adjustments.methodology: Identified correlated risk pairs based on shared root causes; applied reduction for overlapping exposures

pairs_adjusted.rationale: Labor cost increase directly causes franchise competitiveness decline; not additive risks
Strike-driven franchise loss and strike-driven customer attrition are same event impact
Same facility; corrective action concerns drive permit denial scenario

correlation_adjustments.notes: Correlation adjustment prevents double-counting of causally related risks. Phoenix franchise exposure is PRIMARY; labor costs and strike are CONTRIBUTORS to that exposure.

quantification_methodology.time_classification_approach: Classified each exposure as ONE_TIME (face value), MULTI_YEAR (DCF at 8%), or PERPETUAL (NPV = annual/0.08)
quantification_methodology.probability_methodology: Per-finding analyst estimates based on: regulatory precedent, settlement patterns, labor relations history, engineering likelihood, industry benchmarks
quantification_methodology.correlation_methodology: Identified pairs with shared root causes; applied reduction = raw_total × (1 - correlation × overlap_percent)
quantification_methodology.currency_note: All amounts in cents; divide by 100 for dollar values

summary_narrative: The $3.6B UESC acquisition presents $3.47B gross environmental and operational exposure, reduced to $943.4M probability-weighted and $881M after correlation adjustments. Five HIGH-severity findings dominate: Phoenix franchise renewal risk ($320M at 40% probability), RCRA permit uncertainty ($75.6M weighted), landfill airspace depletion ($300M at 45% probability), Teamsters pattern bargaining ($117M at 90% probability), and Superfund liability ($90M weighted across 3 sites). The correlation-adjusted exposure represents 24.5% of transaction value but only 4.9% on a weighted basis, below typical 5% MAE thresholds. However, tail risk scenarios (permit denial + franchise loss simultaneously) could approach deal-blocking levels. Recommended mitigation: $400M escrow (36-48 month duration), $250M purchase price reduction, $300M R&W insurance with full environmental sublimit, regulatory approval conditions precedent for RCRA permit and Albuquerque NPL listing. Critical immediate actions: (1) Initiate Tucson Superfund settlement negotiations to cap $340M joint-several exposure at $27M-$35M, (2) Finalize RCRA permit deficiency response to maximize Dec 2025 approval probability, (3) Proactive Teamsters bargaining April-May 2026 with competitive 18-19% offer to avoid strike (15-20% probability, $24M-$30M cost).
